attributes.action: Known bullies in schools to be prevented from staying on at 6th form
attributes.additional_details: I am a parent of a bullied child, I've witnessed first hand the damage this has caused her. My daughters time at school has been highly unpleasant, why should the victims of bullying be left with no option than to further their education elsewhere? Entry to 6th form should not only be based on academic results. As role models for the younger students it is important to show that bullying will not be tolerated on any level.
attributes.background: It's time for bullying to be taken more seriously, children need to be aware that their actions have consequences. Why allow them to stay on at the school where they have caused extreme distress to other pupils? 6th form students should act as role models for the younger children.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Admissions policies are the responsibility of individual schools and sixth form colleges.
